<details class="orc-details-panel">
<summary><i class="bi bi-clipboard-data"></i> FAIR Research Data Management</summary>

FAIR data management ensures your research outputs are **F**indable, **A**ccessible, **I**nteroperable, and **R**eusable â€” by you, your collaborators, and the wider research community. Apply these principles from the start to save time, enable collaboration, and maximize the impact of your work.

::: {.panel-tabset}

### FAIR Principles

<div class="orc-grid-tools">

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-search"></i> Findable</strong>
<ul>
<li>Deposit in searchable repositories</li>
<li>Use persistent identifiers (DOIs)</li>
<li>Add rich metadata and keywords</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-door-open"></i> Accessible</strong>
<ul>
<li>Open data, or clear request process</li>
<li>Metadata always openly available</li>
<li>Standard protocols for access</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-diagram-3"></i> Interoperable</strong>
<ul>
<li>Use standard terminology</li>
<li>Stable file formats (CSV, JSON)</li>
<li>Avoid proprietary formats</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-arrow-repeat"></i> Reusable</strong>
<ul>
<li>Rich documentation</li>
<li>Clear data provenance</li>
<li>Explicit licenses (e.g., CC-BY)</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>

### Organization & Naming

**File naming conventions:**

- Use descriptive names: `project_instrument_date_version.ext`
- Avoid spaces and special characters (use `_` or `-`)
- Include dates as `YYYY-MM-DD` for chronological sorting
- Add version numbers: `v01`, `v02` or use version control (Git)

**Folder structure:**

- Separate raw data (never modify!), processed data, code, and documentation
- Use a consistent hierarchy across all projects
- Include a README file in each major folder

### Documentation

**README files:** Provide project overview, how to run code, data sources, and contact information.

**Data dictionary (codebook):**

- Variable names and descriptions
- Units of measurement
- Allowed values and missing data codes
- How each variable was collected or derived

**Metadata standards:**

- Find discipline-specific standards on [re3data](https://www.re3data.org/) or [FAIRsharing](https://fairsharing.org/)
- Examples: Dublin Core (general), DDI (social science), BIDS (neuroimaging)

### Storage & Backup

**The 3-2-1 backup rule:**

- **3** copies of your data
- **2** different storage media (e.g., local drive + cloud)
- **1** copy off-site or in a separate location

**Best practices:**

- Use institutional storage (backed up, secure, compliant)
- Never store sensitive data on personal devices
- Transfer data to secure storage regularly
- Document your backup schedule and verify backups work
